page.title: 14Abergavenny News June 1985
page.content: Work on the 5 million pound shopping precinct for Abergavenny town centre is expected to start this autumn. Abergavenny Council cross at mess made by workmen on the Castle Meadows.They want the drainage ditch covered over. Traders want a bus service from the town to the railway station.It is too far to walk. At the Angel Hotel on the 21st Colette Jones was crowned Miss Abergavenny. There was a fire in a flat in St Davids Rd.A family of four were saved. Councillors have prepared a flower bed at Monmouth Rd. Neil Skelton of Harold Rd School is in the semi-finals of a national badminton tournament. Ann Jones has become famous for writing poems.She is the mum of Gavin Jones who attends Harold Road School.
